I've been working on getting the build scripts to automatically track
releases that we will eventuall be distributing to the public so that we
can more easily track bugs as they are reported.

Since these operations should not matter to anyone not involved directly
in development I felt it more appropriate to post documentation of this
process here, rather than including it with the distribution.  There are a
few new features we will want well documented, such as the ability to
fetch old builds/versions from cvs.  This information is included in the
basic readme.txt.

Firstly, there is a strong assumption that compiling release builds builds 
will only be happening on a single machine.  This is important since this 
is the means of assuring unique build/version numbering and requires a 
file to keep track of this that should not be in the cvs repository.

Building Major/Minor Version Releases:

Building a release version (e.g. v1.0) can be done by simply specifying 
'release-version' as the build target when calling ant/startbuild.sh.  The 
version number will be retrieved from build.properties, so if you would 
like to increment it do so there.

Building new 'builds':

Building a 'build' can be done by calling ant/startbuild.sh with the 
target 'release-build'.  This will auto-incriment the (local) build 
number, create the cvs label, and create a package exactly as nightlybuild 
would.

Building old versions:

With this scheme we should be able to build old versions/builds at any 
time, regardless of the current state of the code.  To do so you should 
use the target 'build-by-tag' and include the tag as an additional 
argument, as in:

  startbuild.sh build.xml build-by-tag b1025

Meta-data:

In addition to tracking builds within cvs, all builds will now generate a 
meta-data file called build.metadata that gives useful information about 
how/where/when the code was built.  This should ease bug reporting and 
also may provide useful information we can show to user as part of the 
Heritrix user interface (for example reporting version/build information 
so they can include it in bug reports).

Let me know if you have any questions,
